article_title: Fifty Years Later, Famed St. Louis Arch Gets Facelift
article_text:
Fifty years ago this month, engineers faced a challenge as they tried to put the crucial keystone section into the soaring Gateway Arch in St. Louis.

One leg of the steel structure was expanding in the sun—pushing it out of alignment. So city firefighters were called in to spray down the leg and cool off the hot steel. That allowed a derrick to wedge in the final piece perfectly after the massive legs were spread apart. Today, the city is trying to pry new life out of the 630-foot-high monument, which has long symbolized...

twitter.description: Seeking to pry new life out of the iconic St. Louis Gateway Arch, which has long symbolized the city, a coalition of public and private groups has raised some $380 million to revitalize the monument.
twitter.creator: @jbarrchicago

article_summary:
Fifty years ago this month, engineers faced a challenge as they tried to put the crucial keystone section into the soaring Gateway Arch in St. Louis.
One leg of the steel structure was expanding in the sun—pushing it out of alignment.
Today, the city is trying to pry new life out of the 630-foot-high monument, which has long symbolized...
So city firefighters were called in to spray down the leg and cool off the hot steel.
That allowed a derrick to wedge in the final piece perfectly after the massive legs were spread apart.
